title: Mathematics Vocabulary Quiz
description: Challenge yourself with the language of mathematics, from basic arithmetic terms to geometry, algebra, and beyond.

questions.question: What is a 'hypotenuse'?
options: The longest side of a right triangle, opposite the right angle
The shortest side of any triangle
A line that divides a circle in half

questions.question: What does 'quotient' mean?
options: The result of dividing one number by another

questions.question: What is a 'prime number'?
options: The first number in a sequence
A number that ends in zero
A number greater than 1 that has no divisors other than 1 and itself

questions.question: What does 'perpendicular' mean?
options: Two lines that are the same length
Two lines that meet at a right angle (90 degrees)

questions.question: What is an 'integer'?
options: A whole number, positive or negative, including zero

questions.question: What is the 'circumference' of a circle?
options: The center point of the circle
The distance around the outside of the circle

questions.question: What does 'symmetry' mean in mathematics?
options: A property where a shape or object is identical on both sides of a dividing line

questions.question: What is a 'polygon'?
options: A closed plane figure with three or more straight sides

questions.question: What is the 'mean' in statistics?
options: The average, calculated by dividing the sum of values by the number of values
The middle value in a data set

questions.question: What is a 'theorem'?
options: A mathematical statement that has been proven to be true

questions.question: What does 'exponent' refer to?
options: A number indicating how many times a base is multiplied by itself
The base number in a fraction

questions.question: What is a 'ratio'?
options: A comparison of two quantities expressed as a fraction or with a colon

questions.question: What is 'probability'?
options: The number of trials in an experiment
A measure of how likely an event is to occur

questions.question: What is a 'parabola'?
options: A triangle with no equal sides
A U-shaped curve formed by the graph of a quadratic function
A straight line on a graph
A circle drawn on a coordinate plane

questions.question: What does 'congruent' mean in geometry?
options: Shapes that are identical in form and size
Angles that are greater than 90 degrees
